children.name: change
Example - subscribe to the "change" event after initialization
Example - subscribe to the "change" event during initialization

children.description: Fires when the value is changed

children.name: value
Example - set the value of the MaskedTextBox
Example - get the value of the MaskedTextBox

children.description: Gets or sets the value of the MaskedTextBox.

children.name: raw
Example - get the raw value of the MaskedTextBox

children.description: Gets the unmasked value of the MaskedTextBox.

children.name: readonly

parameters.name: readonly `Boolean`
parameters.description: If set to `true` the widget will not allow user input. If set to `false` the widget will allow user input.

children.description: Toggles the readonly state of the widget. When the widget is readonly it doesn't allow user input.> There is a difference between disabled and readonly mode. The value of a disabled widget is **not** posted as part of a `form` whereas the value of a readonly widget is posted.

parameters.name: enable `Boolean`
parameters.description: If set to `true` the widget will be enabled. If set to `false` the widget will be disabled.

children.name: destroy
children.description: Prepares the **MaskedTextBox** for safe removal from DOM. Detaches all event handlers and removes jQuery.data attributes to avoid memory leaks.> **Important:** This method does not remove the MaskedTextBox element from DOM.

children.name: Example - get options of the widget
value
Example - specify value option as a HTML attribute

children.description: Specifies the value of the MaskedTextBox widget.

children.name: unmaskOnPost
Example - unmask value on form post

children.description: Specifies whether the widget will unmask the input value on form post (available since Q1 2015).

children.name: rules
Example - specify a custom rule as a function
Example - specify a custom rule as a RegExp instance

children.description: Defines an object of custom mask rules.

children.name: promptChar
children.description: Specifies the character used to represent the absence of user input in the widget

children.name: mask
Example - specify a phone number mask

children.description: Specifies the input mask. The following mask rules are supported:- **0** - Digit. Accepts any digit between 0 and 9.- **9** - Digit or space. Accepts any digit between 0 and 9, plus space.- **#** - Digit or space. Like **9** rule, but allows also (+) and (-) signs.- **L** - Letter. Restricts input to letters a-z and A-Z. This rule is equivalent to [a-zA-Z] in regular expressions.- **?** - Letter or space. Restricts input to letters a-z and A-Z. This rule is equivalent to [a-zA-Z] in regular expressions.- **&** - Character. Accepts any character. The rule is equivalent to *\S* in regular expressions.- **C** - Character or space. Accepts any character. The rule is equivalent to *.* in regular expressions.- **A** - Alphanumeric. Accepts letters and digits only.- **a** - Alphanumeric or space. Accepts letters, digits and space only.- **.** - Decimal placeholder. The decimal separator will be get from the current culture used by Kendo.- **,** - Thousands placeholder. The display character will be get from the current culture used by Kendo.- **$** - Currency symbol. The display character will be get from the current culture used by Kendo.

children.name: culture
children.description: Specifies the culture info used by the widget.

children.name: clearPromptChar
children.description: Specifies whether the widget will replace the prompt characters with spaces on blur. Prompt chars will be shown again on focus (available since Q2 2014 SP1).
